availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, gardener. Native of Wurtemberg, Germany. Married to Mary Garnet Wurtele in Louisville in January 1844. Father of Mary Wurtele, Louisa Wurtele, Barbara Wurtele, Alex Wurtele, Andrew Wurtele, Andrew Wurtele, Jacob Wurtele, Regina Wurtele, Rosa Wurtele. Farmer in Louisville, Kentucky in 1850. Gardener in Louisville in 1860. Employed Joseph Roadchelts, Ann Roadchelts, John Grover, Andrew Gamett, Fred Kohling, in 1860. Owned one enslaved man in Louisville in 1860.
